Welcome to TaskAPI’s documentation!¶

TaskAPI main¶

Flask project

TaskAPI API¶

class app.api.TaskNew(api=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
post()[source]¶

Add a Task (Factorial of a number) in the queue and save in database

This function allows users to create a task to compute the factorial of a given number

Returns

Task’s information in json and http status code

  • Example:

    curl -X POST "http://localhost:5000/api/tasks" -H "accept: application/json" -H "Content-Type: application/json"                         -d "{ 
        "number": 4
    }"

  • Expected Success Response:

    HTTP Status Code: 201

{
    "task_id": "778adfbc-5b28-4e27-b00c-a6438e073220",
    "status": "PENDING"
}

  • Expected Fail Response:

    HTTP Status Code: 400

{
    "errors": 
    {
        "number": "'1' is not of type 'integer'"
    },
    "message": "Input payload validation failed"
}
class app.api.TaskStatus(api=None, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶
get(task_id)[source]¶

Get task status (PENDING or COMPLETED) given the task id

This function allows user to get the status of a task already submitted given it’s task_id.

Parameters

task_id (String) – id of the task

Returns

task’s status information in json and http status code

  • Example:

    curl -X GET "http://localhost:5000/api/tasks/778adfbc-5b28-4e27-b00c-a6438e073220" -H "accept: application/json"

  • Expected Success Response:

    HTTP Status Code: 200

{
    "task_id": "778adfbc-5b28-4e27-b00c-a6438e073220",
    "status": "SUCCESS"
}

  • Expected Fail Response:

    HTTP Status Code: 400

{
    "task_id": "1",
    "message": "Given task id does not exist in database"
}
app.api.add_task_db(task_id)[source]¶

Save Task to database

This saves the task to the task table in the database.

TaskAPI celery¶

app.celery.make_celery(app)[source]¶

Make a celery app instance and return it with app context passed as parameter

This function allows users to create celery app instances in their module with the app context to define celery tasks and other functions.

param

current app

return

Celery instance
